meanings.sent1: The skiagraphs of the trees were cast on the ground by the setting sun.
meanings.sent2: She studied the skiagraphs of the objects under the bright light.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to play with the skiagraphs of his hands on the wall.
meanings.sent4: In the dim room, the skiagraphs of the furniture looked like eerie silhouettes.
meanings.sent5: The artist used skiagraphs to create a mysterious atmosphere in the painting.

meanings.definition: to create a shadow image or outline
meanings.sent1: He carefully skiagraphs the profile of the mountain against the sky.
meanings.sent2: The photographer skiagraphs the model against the bright backdrop.
meanings.sent3: The magician skiagraphs his hand to create illusions for the audience.
meanings.sent4: She skiagraphs the flower on the paper, capturing its delicate details.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor skiagraphs the figure before carving it into marble.

meanings.definition: the process of creating a shadow image or outline
meanings.sent1: The skiagraphs of the building were made using a special technique.
meanings.sent2: She learned about the skiagraphs during her art class.
meanings.sent3: The skiagraphs of the animals in the zoo fascinated the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The skiagraphs of the clouds in the sky changed with the passing hours.
meanings.sent5: The skiagraphs of the cityscape were displayed in the photography exhibition.
